bio.title: Bio
content: Hi there! I’m Claudio, a Mexican web designer / front-end developer freelancing from Monterrey, Mexico. At the moment I’m looking for a job opportunity in the United States as a Product Designer with a focus on design systems or business tools.

I graduated from Baylor University with a BBA in Entrepreneurship on May 2014. I first learned about design my senior year of college as a part of the Baylor Accelerated Ventures Program. During my last semester I signed up for an introductory Media Design class and fell in love with design.

After graduation I moved to Phoenix to help an old friend start a video production company. I lived in Phoenix for 9 months during which I learned about startups, business, video editing, animation, and worked for Brushfire Interactive as a freelance Motion Designer.

I moved to Monterrey, Mexico and worked for Parámetro Studio as a Junior Web Designer the fall of 2015. I left Parámetro and continued freelancing for Brushfire while working on web projects for local clients. During 2016 I learned about design process, front-end development and got a chance to be a part of Epicurrence in Moab, UT.

My goals and aspirations are to become a US citizen, be a part of a team that works on a business product with global impact, stay healthy, and help new designers (like myself) learn about design and development.
